body_html:
Depends on if you're using tf 1.1 or the tf nighties. If you're using tf 1.1 then you need to reuse the variable scope from the first call to dynamic rnn to ensure you're using the same parameters in the second call. In the nighties, so long as you use the same cell object in the second call, your parameters will be shared regardless of the variable scope/ reuse value.
…

body:
Depends on if you're using tf 1.1 or the tf nighties.  If you're using tf
1.1 then you need to reuse the variable scope from the first call to
dynamic rnn to ensure you're using the same parameters in the second call.
In the nighties, so long as you use the same cell object in the second
call, your parameters will be shared regardless of the variable scope/
reuse value.

On May 9, 2017 4:17 PM, "Zongheng Yang" <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> Short answer is reuse=True only affects the tf.Variable objects. @ebrevdo
> <https://github.com/ebrevdo> on the dynamic_rnn() part.
